title: Wakefield 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Adelaide Hills)
description: Medium pink in color and smelling of cherry cordial and soap, the dry palate is slightly creamy in texture, with balanced acidity and more ripe red fruits.

title: 786 Wines 2016 Merlot (California)
description: Spicy aromas and jammy flavors make this medium-bodied wine exuberant and rich, turning off dry on the palate where the texture is velvety.

title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2016 Riesling (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This off-dry, lightweight and simple wine contains 28 g/L of residual sugar. It's grainy and lightly lemony, finishing with sweet tea-like tannins.

title: Amarano 2016 Lucinda Coda di Volpe (Irpinia)
description: This has subtle aromas of white and yellow stone fruit that follow over to the simple, dilute palate. Fresh acidity gives it a slightly tangy sensation before a quick close.

title: Arrocal 2014 Passión  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Minty black fruit and grilled meat aromas lend this wine a green, herbaceous tone. Its tannic palate tastes of weedy berries and burnt wood. Herbal, green notes and raw tannins overpower the finish, feeling underripe at every point.

title: Bennett Valley Cellars 2013 Bin 6410 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This is a reduced, quite oaky wine up front, with a stemmy character of earthiness that presents as slightly odd. Black cherry defines the fruit component while a richness of caramel marks a background note.

title: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Bulería Fino Sherry (Jerez)
description: This is a rich and honeyed style of Fino, with cashew and oxidized aromas. On the palate, expect a flat, full-bodied experience. Briny, nutty flavors recall blue cheese and salted peanuts. It's blocky and demanding.

title: Domaine Chiroulet 2017 Terres Blanches White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Lightly mineral in character, this a floral blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng. At the moment, herbal flavors predominate, but give the wine a few months and the riper fruits of the Gros Manseng will come through and give a deliciously aromatic wine.

title: Domaine de Ménard 2017 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Situated in the heart of Armagnac country, this estate produces a range of crisp, fruity wines. The green fruits and herbal character of this typical local blend are refreshing, light and bright. Drink the wine now.

title: Domaine de Ménard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Totally herbal, this crisp wine is all about richly flavored Sauvignon Blanc. It has weight despite its low alcohol, and is full of green and citrus fruits. The cut-grass aroma sings of a summer's day and this makes a great aperitif to drink right then.

title: Kramer 2015 Celebrate Müller-Thurgau (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Kramer's Celebrate series features non-traditional sparkling wine grapes that are carbonated in tank rather than re-fermented in the bottle. This delivers bubblegum scents and light pear and tropical fruit flavors, with a little funk on the finish.

title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2015 Pyrène L'Inimitable Pays de Cocagne Red (Comté Tolosan)
description: The land of Cocagne, Southwest France's legendary land of milk and honey, provides this soft, fruity blend of Merlot, Tannat and Syrah. It has a touch of spice, plenty of black-currant fruit and balanced acidity. It's light, fruity and ready to drink.

title: Lusco 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Golden in color and heavy on the apricot and peach aromas, this seems just past its prime. Citrusy acidity keeps the palate jumpy, while apple and spiced pear flavors lose steam on the unsculpted finish.

title: Manos Andinas 2017 Reserva Hand Harvested Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
description: This opens with a neutral nose. Its tangy palate with lean, salty citrus fruit and zesty acidity finishes short and punchy.

title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Portal da Aguia Rosé (Tejo)
description: Tinta Roriz and Syrah make a crisp, bright, red-currant-flavored wine. Fruity but with zesty acidity, it's refreshing and ready to drink.

title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Espirito Lagoalva Red (Tejo)
description: This wine is smooth and rich. Grown on the sandy soils of the estate, it offers gentle tannins and bright red fruits. Almost sweet in character, the fruit is soft, open although with a good streak of acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Quinta do Arrobe 2016 Oculto Extra Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)
description: This soft blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto is already showing maturity. While the label indicates extra dry, the softness of the wine is most marked. The aftertaste has creamy fruit and a touch of vanilla.

title: Rued 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: There's a lot of oak at the heart of this otherwise light-bodied wine, and after the oak is more oak. Lacking complexity, the flavors tend toward one-note versions of cranberry, red currant and pencil shavings.

title: Villa Dria 2017 Villa Club Nacré White (Gers)
description: This wine is light, with perfumed acidity and a crisp, bright texture. It is just off dry, cut with acidity, melon and gooseberry flavors. The aftertaste is all fruit.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Escolha White (Tejo)
description: This wine is all fruit, with a light texture from the lees aging before bottling. It has softened from the initial intense fruit so that it is a refreshing wine with a smooth, creamy aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Escolha

title: Benziger 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Muted and tannic, this wine is simple and lean on the midpalate, with flavors of red and black currant and yeasty bread.

title: Callaway 2014 Winemaker's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Dried red cherries and blueberries meet with peppercorn and oregano on the nose of this wine. The flavors are oddly tangy and tart, with cherry, blackberry, pine and juniper, enhanced by a bit of earthy crushed gravel.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Rosé (Contra Costa County)
description: Soft-textured and relatively full-bodied, this wine smells peachy, tastes ripe and lush and has little noticeable acidity.

title: Cantina del Vesuvio 2016 Bianco White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)
description: This informal white has subdued aromas of white spring flower and citrus. The simple light-bodied palate offers suggestions of lemon zest and yellow apple alongside fresh acidity.

title: Casa di Monte 2014 Le Capitozze  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with earthy aromas of game, tilled soil and black plum. The simple palate delivers black cherry, clove and a touch of orange peel alongside loose-knit tannins.

title: Cerulean 2012 Nebbiolo (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This rare example of Nebbiolo in the state. is quite pale in color, with cherry, citrus, smoke and wet earth aromas. It's light in both flavor and concentration.

title: Château Bélingard 2017 White (Bergerac)
description: This blend has a dominance of Sauvignon Blanc with a perfumed input from Muscadelle. It is full of pear, quince and green apple flavors, with a tight edge that needs to soften.

title: Davey Family 2015 Estate Grown Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: A little old fashioned in style, this wine shows plush plummy fruit, vanilla and cola aromas that are overpowered by sweet oak spice. The palate is tart and tangy, with more plummy fruit, savory spices and chunky, oaky tannins.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Bigode Red (Lisboa)
description: This wine holds an eclectic blend of at least seven grapes. The result is a ripe, fruity wine, lightly tannic and full of berry flavors cut with red-currant acidity. This wine, packed with fruitiness, can be drunk now.

title: Enoport 2017 Vinhas Altas Branco White (Vinho Verde)
description: This crisp, off-dry wine offers clean, bright white and citrus fruits. A slight prickle adds to the freshness and lift of this wine that needs to be drunk immediately.
